org.opensha.geo

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha.geo.Location
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Location>

    public final class Location
extends Object
implements Comparable<Location>
    A Location represents a point with reference to the earth's ellipsoid. It is expressed in terms of latitude, longitude, and depth. As in seismology, the convention adopted in here is for depth to be positive-down, always. All utility methods in this package assume this to be the case. Locations may be defined using longitude values in the range: [-180°, 360°]. Location instances are immutable.

    Note that although static factory methods take arguments in the order: [lat, lon, depth], String representations of a Location are in the order: [lon, lat, depth], consistent with KML, GeoJSON, and other digital coordinate formats that match standard plotting coordinate order: [x, y, z].

    For computational cenvenience, latitude and longitude values are converted and stored internally in radians. Special get***Rad() methods are provided to access this native format.

    Author:
    Peter Powers

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Location loc)
        Compares this Location to another and sorts first by latitude, then by longitude. When sorting a list of randomized but evenly spaced grid of Locations, the resultant ordering will be left to right across rows of uniform latitude, ascending to the leftmost next higher latitude at the end of each row (left-to-right, bottom-to-top).
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Location>
        Parameters:
        loc - Location to compare this to
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this Location is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified Location.

        Returns a Function that can be used to convert Strings to Locations.
        Returns:
        a String to Location conversion function
